Your software development project is contractually set for 18 months, but the client now requests completion 2 months earlier due to regulatory changes. What is the best approach?
options: Inform the customer about the impact on project constraints and, after approval, crash the project.
Accept the customer’s request and cut parts of the project scope.
Stick to your original schedule and refuse any change.
Cut the duration of all project activities to meet the new deadline.
costManagement.answer: Inform the customer about the impact on project constraints and, after approval, crash the project.

humanResourceManagement.question: What is the focus of human resource management?

A customer-assigned team member is confrontational and intimidates project members. How should you handle this situation?
options: Ask the customer to replace the person.
Unilaterally isolate the person from project meetings.
Do nothing since they were assigned by the client.
Confront the person about their behavior and inform the customer.
humanResourceManagement.answer: Confront the person about their behavior and inform the customer.

humanResourceManagement.question: Your sponsor is leaving the project and will be replaced by two people. She claims that adding one more member won’t significantly affect communication complexity. Is she correct?
options: Yes, because the sponsor is always right.
Yes, adding one additional person adds only one more communication channel.
No, Agile teams should be as small as possible.
No, adding one more person adds more than one communication channel.
humanResourceManagement.answer: No, adding one more person adds more than one communication channel.
